intro: Leandra agrestis, commonly known as the marsh leandra, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, often with a contrasting throat. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Leandra agrestis plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing nectar for pollinators.
